facts: Dr. Jekyll's renewed social life and religious activities for about two months after Sir Danvers Carew's murder correspond to his resolution to abandon Hyde, though he eventually gives in to temptation.

This fact connects Jekyll's outward behavior with his internal struggle, showing how his attempt to suppress Hyde manifested in his social life.
